lines.line: Flurry of chickadees, feeding then gone.
A single cardinal stipples an empty branch â€“
I turn my blessings like photographs into the light;
over my shoulder the god of Not-Yet looks on:
Not-yet-dead, not-yet-lost, not-yet-taken. Not-yet-shattered, not-yet-sectioned, not-yet-strewn.
Ample litany, sparing nothing I hate or love,
I move my ear a little closer to that humming figure,
I ask him only to stay.
